Lucas Oil founder and motorsports icon Forrest Lucas dies at 83, leaving $500 million empire
data.description: Indiana native Forrest Lucas, the man behind Lucas Oil Products, passed away at 83. He started his company in 1989 with his wife Charlotte. Lucas Oil became a big name in motorsports. The company sponsors the Indianapolis Colts and Indiana Pacers. Lucas also owned MAVTV, now RACER Network. His net worth was around $500 million.
data.keywords: Forrest Lucas, Lucas Oil Products, Lucas Oil founder, lucas oil founder dies, motorsports icon, forest lucas net worth, lucas, racer media, forest lucas children, forest lucas wife

data.title: Brazilian forward Brenner returns to Cincinnati on loan; check his past records with the club
data.description: FC Cincinnati welcomes back Brazilian striker Brenner on loan from Udinese through the end of the 2025 season, with an option to buy. The 25-year-old previously scored 27 goals for Cincinnati from 2021-2023. General Manager Chris Albright expressed excitement about adding Brenner's dynamic goal-scoring ability to the team as they contend for the Supporters' Shield.

data.title: Apple claims former employee, China’s Oppo stole trade secrets
data.description: Apple has sued Oppo, accusing it of poaching Apple Watch engineer Chen Shi and encouraging him to steal trade secrets. Shi allegedly downloaded confidential health-sensing technology files before joining Oppo in June. Apple claims Oppo knowingly benefited to develop competing wearables, while Oppo denies wrongdoing and pledges cooperation with legal proceedings.
data.keywords: Apple lawsuit, Oppo trade secrets, Apple intellectual property, Chen Shi Apple Watch, tech industry litigation, Oppo Silicon Valley, Oppo legal response, Apple vs Oppo lawsuit
